entry.title: Deanonymisation of clients in Bitcoin P2P network paper
entry.summary: It appears that the conversation revolves around the idea of mainstream wallets and wallets designed for cryptocurrency research sharing a common core. The speaker clarifies that they believe this should be the case, and notes bitcoinj as an example of a wallet engine already in use. The conversation then shifts to discussing BIP70 and the fact that the PaymentRequest message is signed but not the Payment message. The reason for this is because it is intended to be submitted via HTTPS, but the question arises as to what key the message would be signed with.
